p: Culicine mosquitoes such as Aedes and Culex are the main vector of arboviruses such as dengue virus (DENV; genus Flavivirus, family Flaviviridae), yellow fever virus (YFV, genus Flavivirus, family Flaviviridae), chikungunya (CHIKV, genus Alphavirus, family Togaviridae), and others. Only one arbovirus is known to be consistently transmitted by Anopheles mosquitoes, the alphavirus oâ€™nyong-nyong (ONNV, genus Alphavirus, family Togaviridae) [ 6, 7, 8, 9], which is closely related to CHIKV [ 10].
